message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Urticarial reaction is a type I hypersensitivity reaction, which is an allergic reaction. Non-depolarizing neuromuscular blocking agents include D-tubocurarine, atracurium, and cisatracurium. Among the options, only D-tubocurarine is a non-depolarizing neuromuscular blocking agent. Succinylcholine is a depolarizing neuromuscular blocking agent. Neostigmine is a cholinesterase inhibitor used to reverse neuromuscular blockade. Ketamine is a dissociative anesthetic and does not have neuromuscular blocking properties.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Urticarial reaction indicates an allergic response. Non-depolarizing neuromuscular blocking agents such as D-tubocurarine are known to cause allergic reactions, while Succinylcholine is the only depolarizing agent mentioned in the question, and is not typically associated with urticarial reactions. Neostigmine is used to reverse the effects of neuromuscular blockade and is not a neuromuscular blocking agent. Ketamine is a dissociative anesthetic and not a neuromuscular blocking agent.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. An urticarial reaction after the injection of a non-depolarizing neuromuscular blocking agent suggests an allergic reaction, which is most commonly associated with tubocurarine. Succinylcholine is a depolarizing agent and not a non-depolarizing agent. Neostigmine is not a muscle relaxant but rather a medication to reverse the effect of non-depolarizing agents. Ketamine is a dissociative anesthetic and not a muscle relaxant.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The rapid onset and severity of the reaction suggest that the patient experienced anaphylaxis, a severe allergic reaction. Among the options, only D-tubocurarine is a non-depolarizing neuromuscular blocking agent, and it has been associated with anaphylaxis. Succinylcholine is a depolarizing neuromuscular blocking agent and is not associated with allergic reactions of this severity. Neostigmine is a cholinesterase inhibitor used to reverse the effects of neuromuscular blocking agents, and Ketamine is a general anesthetic agent.

Among the options, D-tubocurarine is a non-depolarizing neuromuscular blocking agent, while succinylcholine is a depolarizing neuromuscular blocking agent. Neostigmine and ketamine are not neuromuscular blocking agents.

Succinylcholine is a depolarizing agent and is not associated with urticarial reactions. Neostigmine is a medication used to reverse the effects of neuromuscular blocking agents. Ketamine is a general anesthetic and does not have muscle relaxation properties.

Neostigmine is a cholinesterase inhibitor used to reverse the effects of non-depolarizing neuromuscular blocking agents. Ketamine is a dissociative anesthetic and does not have neuromuscular blocking properties.

Succinylcholine can cause allergic reactions, but not urticaria specifically. Neostigmine and Ketamine are not neuromuscular blocking agents.

Succinylcholine is a depolarizing neuromuscular blocking agent, and neostigmine is a cholinesterase inhibitor used for reversing the effect of neuromuscular blocking agents.
